description: From Latin nostrum (“ours”), nominative neuter of noster (“our, ours”).

entries.meaning: A medicine or remedy in conventional use which has not been proven to have any desirable medical effects.
(by extension) An ineffective but favorite remedy for a problem, usually involving political action.
examples: Neocons have far more interest in foreign policy than domestic policy. As regards the latter the reflex nostrums of right-wing attitudes apply: less tax, less government, libertarianism about matters such as gun control, encouragement of individual responsibility in health care and education, 'faith-based solutions' to social and welfare problems, and so forth.
